text:
87 yo male who presented on [**12-4**]  w/ NSTEMI, acute on chronic
   diastolic CHF exacerbation & anemia d/t GIB. NSTEMI was medically
   managed. Diuresed on Lasix gtt  & tnsf w/ prbc. Stable & called out to
   floor [**12-9**]. Triggered back [**12-11**] prior to scheduled endoscopy for
   changes in MS, fevers (104 pr) ^ wbc 22 (13.4) ^ loose stools (ob+).
   Prob C-diff, 1^st sample ([**12-12**]) is positive, started on iv flagyl
   (vanco/zosyn) Pt also in/out of rapid AF, being successfully tx w/ iv
   lopressor q4. MS has improved, now alert, responds to vocal & follows
   commands. Conts w/ low grade fevers (99.4-7ax), Cre 2.6 (baseline).
   ECHO done showed no vegetations/ dry, has iv fluids infusing
   Gastrointestinal bleed, upper (Melena, GI Bleed, GIB)
   Assessment:
   Hct 31.6 this am down from 34.3 [**12-12**], multiple stools, brown, loose,
   Action:
   Guiac stool, follow hct
   Response:
   Ob+
   Plan:
   Mon;itor hct, s/s bleeding, guiac stool
   Renal failure, acute (Acute renal failure, ARF)
   Assessment:
   Cr ^ 3.0 from 2.6 [**12-13**], u/o began trending down mid day
   Action:
    started on ns 125cc/hr
   Response:
   u/o improving
   Plan:
   Follow renal fx
   C. difficile infection (C Diff, Cdiff Colitis, Clostridium Difficile)
   Assessment:
   Multiple sm-med loose brn stool, tm 100.2., abd increasingly  distended
   and tender
   Action:
   Flagyl d/c, zosyn d/c, vancomycin changed from iv to po, KUB done, plan
   for ct, pt taking baracat, starting at
   1700
   Response:
   Cont stooling, low grade temp
   Plan:
   Monitor temp, stool, abdominal assessment, CT scan this eve
